fields.description:
I'm using deployhq for automated deployments. I keep a master, a staging and a live branch to keep code separate. I mostly work on master. When I think it should be deployed to the staging server, I checkout staging, merge master into it, and then push to remote staging. The problem is, if I already pushed the same commit to remote master, pushing to remote staging will not fire the post hook again.

The automated deployment gets the payload, sees that it's on branch master, and ignores it. It does not get the payload with branch staging in it (which it should use for deployment).

So essentially unless I push to staging first, I can't get automated deployments working. This is true when trying to deploy to a live site once everyone gave the thumbs up on the staging. Ideally it would be a checkout live, merge staging, push upstream live, and done.

Any plans on making bitbucket fire hooks on push?
fields.summary: Hook fires only once for commit even if pushed to multiple branches (BB-9847)

fields.description:
This is the auto-enumerated list in _reST_:

{code}
#!rst
    1. Item 1
    #. Item 2
    #. Item 3

       a. Subitem 3.a.
       #. Subitem 3.b.
       #. Subitem 3.c.

          i. Subsubitem 3.c.i.
          #. Subsubitem 3.c.ii.

       #. Subitem 3.d.

          i. Subsubitem 3.d.i

             Yes, you must re-specify the sequence type you want.
             This subsub-list is separate from the previous subsub-list.

          #. Subsubitem 3.d.ii

    #. Item 4.

       a. Subitem 4.a.

          Yup, recall that you must re-specify the sequence type here.

       #. Subitem 4.b.
{code}

Expected to produce this:

{code}
#!rst
    1. Item 1
    2. Item 2
    3. Item 3

       a. Subitem 3.a.
       b. Subitem 3.b.
       c. Subitem 3.c.

          i. Subsubitem 3.c.i.
          ii. Subsubitem 3.c.ii.

    ...
{code}

Instead produces this:

{code}
#!rst
    1. Item 1
    2. Item 2
    3. Item 3

       1. Subitem 3.a.
       2. Subitem 3.b.
       3. Subitem 3.c.

          1. Subsubitem 3.c.i.
          2. Subsubitem 3.c.ii.

    ...
{code}
fields.summary: reST nested auto-enumerated lists don't work in Wiki (BB-9855)

fields.summary: Importing git repo from github is not working: bbae588e49bc4446b23d16536bf7d236

fields.description:
*Issue*:

Cannot create pull request against the correct destination branch.

*Issue description*:

I have a pull request (\\
https://bitbucket.org/MatthewTurk/yt/pull-request/11/misc-fixes-fixes-and-tests-for-operations/diff)\\
that I am unable to apply against the correct head on the destination\\
repository. I am trying to pull\\
request into the unitrefactor bookmark on the destination (when I opened the pull request, this was 943c100, since the PR has been merged manually now this changeset is no longer the head). When I view the pull request using the "Edit"\\
button, I am able to choose the correct destination branch and the diff\\
renders correctly.

Unfortunately, when I actually update the pull request, it appears as if\\
the diff is against the Stable branch - a completely different head\\
compared to the one I requested.

The strange this is, I was able to select the correct destination just a\\
couple of days ago. However starting yesterday this appears to not work\\
anymore.

This is for a mercurial repository.  I have no idea if this problem is isolated to mercurial or is a general issue with bitbucket's branch pull request functionality.

*Intended behavior*:

I would like to be able to open pull requests against arbitrary heads in\\
the destination repository.

*Actual behavior*:

I am currently only able to open pull requests against the "default" head.

----
For now we are reviewing contributions manually on this repository,\\
obviously this is less than ideal. Please let us know if you discover\\
anything or need more information.
fields.summary: Cannot select destination pull request head

fields.description:
I had reported the problems in issues BCLOUD-8619 , BCLOUD-8618 , BCLOUD-8620 that all had one same problem. problem was of the content type {{application/x-www-form-urlencoded}}.

On the version {{1.0}} the content type {{application/x-www-url-form-encoded}} working to post data form.

but on the version {{2.0}} the content type{{application/x-www-form-urlencoded}} working to post data form.

[Read More...|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8618/the-owner-parameter-not-working-to-the]
fields.summary: bitbucket api not working to x-www-form-urlencoded on the version 1.0

fields.description:
I was using Chrome to read this page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Set+up+SSH+for+Git

It told me I should use another browser to copy the code, because Chrome (and Opera) inserts non-breaking space characters. I opened Firefox and directed it to the page, and found only a gray squiggly line where the code should have been. Viewing the source, I was able to copy the code.

From the W3C:

The script element allows authors to include dynamic script and data blocks in their documents. The element does not represent content for the user.

http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/scripting-1.html#the-script-element

Please stop using script tags this way! So far I think Safari and Internet Explorer are the only two major browsers that might still do want you intend, and I hate using both of them.
fields.summary: Stop using HTML script tags to mark up visible code.

fields.description:
When there are commends on a pull request for a prior version of the file that are now hidden it displays an icon that looks like a word balloon with an elipsis in it and a badge/label with the number of hidden comments.

Usually when I click this they load in an overlay via ajax.  Now the spinner never goes away.  I see a couple requests go out to google analytics, and then a second or two later a request aimed at\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{account}/{project}/pullrequests/{pr number}/updates?since=2013-12-10T18%3A23%3A43.275542

The ajax response that comes back over the wire is something like: {"destRevMoved": false, "rebased": false, "approvalsAdded": [], "lastModified": "2013-12-10T18:24:03.369364", "commentsReplied": [], "approvalsRemoved": [], "updates": [], "commentsDeleted": [], "prDetailsModified": false, "commentsEdited": [], "commentsAdded": [], "viewers": [], "anchorMoved": false}

Not sure if that helps, as it seems like it's an occasional ping for general updates rather than something related to the UI action I took.
fields.summary: Comments on prior versions broken

fields.description:
I converted some Repos from personal to team.

For other team members, the https url is correct. For me, the https url still has my personal username in it. So, when I changed the remote url, no one else could pull (they would get auth error). I can manually change it, but it took a little to find out what was going on.

Steps to recreate:

# create a repo
# convert the repo to a team repo
# look at your https url for that repo, and look at the ssh addr. The ssh is correct, the https is not.
fields.summary: Converting a Repo from personal to team is Awesome, except my https url still has my personal username

fields.description:
To reproduce

* User A sends a message to User B
* User B sees message, replies, then deletes the message
* User A replies to the reply
* User B will see that they have a message in the User menu, but they will not see anything in their inbox

Note that if you have email enabled, you _will_ receive the notification in your email.
fields.summary: A deleted message with a reply will not show up in inbox (BB-9660)

fields.description:
An initial pull request can be submitted by Bob.\\
Teammates review and approve.\\
Bob decides to update his pull request with subsequent commits introducing errors.\\
Previous approvals still stand as misnomers when the PR has changed.

This is a problem and not accurate leading to merges of potentially problematic code.

Request to remove previous approvals if a PR is updated before it is merged.
fields.summary: Previous approvals should be unapproved when a Pull Request is updated and not yet merged
Merge conflict instructions are wrong. (BB-9658)

This makes it really annoying to read the commit history.

fields.description:
When you edit an issue's title the new comment automatically created is of a form:

{code}
<NAME>

* changed title to <NEW TITLE>
{code}

The thing is, this makes sense for all but the first title edit, because the first title is essentially forever lost at that point. I think it should say {{changed title **from**}} this way you'll have a complete history.

This may affect other fields.
fields.summary: Editing an issue should log both old/new values (BB-9711)

# Press "Attach"

I've got:

* error page 500 (debug info: 97e738109fd249c197a82d8eefe6ce6d)
* all files or part of files attached (after reopening page)
* created comment with list of part attached file names (not all of them)

Browser: Google Chrome 31.0.1650.57 m
fields.summary: Error 500 during upload files

fields.description:
If you click the link "Teams > Create Team" from the menu you get a 404 error. This appears not to work elsewhere too!

https://bitbucket.org/account/create-team/
fields.summary: Teams links do not work

fields.description: Something that could help with debugging: cd2805a6148a49e28f87a1f9d1043ffc
fields.summary: Import repo from github gives 500 in a ajax request

fields.description:
I sent 2 invitations to my classmates and unfortunately the email is in Chinese. Maybe it's because my bitbucket account's locale is set to Chinese(China).

I didn't see any option to choose the language of the invitation email so I thought it should be in English. And of course I received a relply from one of them telling me that the invitation email is not understandable. So I changed my account settings and sent invitations again. I am not sure whether it is in English this time because I haven't received any feedback.

Now I changed my account setting back to Chinese again. By choosing Chinese in my account setting, I am not meaning that all my friends speak Chinese. So I think this place might be changed to make the site more usable.
fields.summary: Invitation email language issue (BB-9685)

fields.description:
* 

My url is {{https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?responsible=rss_samuel}}.

!http://f.cl.ly/items/1C2h0u3G150k1O1D0r1a/my-issues.png!
fields.summary: "My issues" should be renamed to "Assigned to me" (BB-9651)

fields.description: This change on github https://github.com/blog/1707-soft-wrapping-on-prose-diffs is really helpful for comparing edits to docs. Would be wonderful if the functionality was available here as well.
fields.summary: Add support for soft wrapping prose in diffs

fields.description:
This issue surprisingly seems intermittent, but when it happens it can be constant.

When creating a basic "pull request" you'll click the form with no response ( no errors, etc ). Only when viewing the network request in a console will you find a 500.

I can provide a URL to a Bitbucket employee ( as it appears to contain sensitive information ), but the error/contents of the URL is as follows:

{"error": {"message": "duplicate key value violates unique constraint "bb_userprefs_user_id_1feb457749eed4bc_uniq"
DETAIL:  Key (user_id, key)=(1926603, close-anchor-branch) already exists.
", "detail": "  File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/piston/resource.py", line 198, in *call*
    result = checked_meth(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/piston/resource.py", line 185, in checked_meth
    return meth(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/newrelic-2.5.0.94/newrelic/hooks/component_piston.py", line 33, in *call*
    return self._nr_wrapped(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2013-07-26/bitbucket/../bitbucket/apps/api/v10/handlers.py", line 5242, in read
    result = taskresult.get()
  File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/result.py", line 108, in get
    interval=interval)
  File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/backends/base.py", line 185, in wait_for
    raise result
", "id": "d677f786456a4a
fields.summary: 500 when pressing "Create pull request"

fields.description:
The 500 error page said this might be helpful for debugging the issue:

725ce811130a46e4a59d4d0186b3213f
fields.summary: Excessively large Git diff crashes with 500 (BB-9639)
Why the User Endpoint not include email ?

fields.description:
* 

My users authenticate by my application but they can not unauthenticate by my application.

I want my users to delete my application of _Integrated applications list_ but through my application and not through bitbucket admin panel.

!http://f.cl.ly/items/002Q2C400l2C2j0i1J2Z/integrated%20application-delete.png!
fields.summary: Is there any way for unauthenticate by api ?

fields.description:
After using the same deployment key for various repositories I decided to use the same key as SSH key to avoid adding this key for each repository.\\
However when I try to add the SSH key I receive the message “Someone has already registered this as a deploy key.”. I checked all my repositories, but none have a deployment key registered with the same ssh key.\\
Maybe Bitbucket is checking a deleted repository for any deployment keys?
fields.summary: Can't change deployment key to SSH key.

fields.description:
In the Administration tab, I would change forking mode from "Allow only private forks" to "Allow forks".\\
But it was not possible until I check "This is a private repository"

I think that the condition is reversed.

Workaround: check "private repo", change the forking mode and then uncheck "private". The forking mode is saved.

For public repository, the widgets are: see unchecked.png

After checking the "private repo" box: see checked.png
fields.summary: Changing forking mode is only available for private repository !

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to manage a team's e-mail address(es), as is possible for individual accounts.

Use case: I've mistakenly used a secondary e-mail address for my individual BitBucket account, and my primary e-mail address for a BitBucket team, and now there is no way to fix this.
fields.summary: Add option to update a team's e-mail address

fields.description:
Opened a PR with 3 reviewers (or maybe 2?) and received some comments/stuff to fix.

Pushed to the branch with the fixes, and got the tooltip from the edit button to "update" as changes had been detected.

After updating, there is now 6 reviewers on the list!

I think it automagically added the 'suggested reviewers' when it updated the PR :(
fields.summary: When a PR is updated (with new commit changes), more reviewers are added!

fields.description:
on auiplugin-5.3.x branch:

{code}
aui auiplugin-5.3.x $ git push
Counting objects: 53, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (19/19), done.
Writing objects: 100% (19/19), 2.05 KiB, done.
Total 19 (delta 10), reused 0 (delta 0)
fatal: Unable to create '/data/netapp01/netapp01_sas01_02/data/d-617/r-432617/refs/heads/auiplugin-5.3.x.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}

This is blocking a release for JIRA, which is needed by tomorrow.
fields.summary: Error pushing to atlassian/aui

fields.description:
A few days ago I created a new repository on my account and it opened a 500 error window with a debug code 015776bdda1249d5aa88bc0829f6c11d

I cannot open the repo since then and so consequently I cannot remove it or rename or try anything to fix it.
fields.summary: Cannot access newly created repository

fields.description:
Sieć tworzona przez Cloud Mobilny powinna być hierarchiczna z maksymalną stałą ilością dzieci przypadających na jedno urządzenie rodzica. W dalszych rozważaniach taka stała będzie nazywana *MaximalChildrenQuantity*. Proces dołączania nowego urządzenia mobilnego do Clouda powinien zostać przeprowadzony według następujących reguł.

h3. Nowe urządzenie mobilne łączy się z Cloudem z wykorzystaniem adresu IP roota
# Jeśli bieżąca ilość dzieci jest mniejsza niż *MaximalChildrenQuantity* to każde nowe urządzenie mobilne staje się dzieckiem roota.
# Jeśli warunek z punktu pierwszego nie jest spełniony to nowe urządzenie mobilne jest rekursywnie przydzielane do dziecka roota, które w danym momencie ma najmniejszą ilość dzieci.

h3. Nowe urządzenie mobilne łączy się z Cloudem z wykorzystaniem adresu IP innego urządzania niż root
Zadanie dołączenia nowego urządzenia mobilnego do Clouda zostaje odesłane do roota całej sieci.
fields.summary: Dołączanie urządzeń mobilnych do Clouda
The better searching for receive repositories by bitbucket api
Why bitbucket api doesn't support the PUT method in version 2 ?!

fields.description:
I need to all the users authenticated by my bitbucket application.

There is here any way for receive they?!

for example:

{{/api/2.0/users/}} ?

or

{{/api/2.0/users/authenticated}} ?

*
fields.summary: How I can to receive all authenticated users by api?

fields.description: This is similar to Issue BCLOUD-2659 "Show all of the pages in the wiki on a page" but would list just a subset, only those wiki pages that are 'orphaned.'  Orphaned pages are pages that don't have any links to them.   This is a very important feature to maintain & refactor a Wiki.
fields.summary: List 'orphaned' wiki pages (BB-9636)

fields.description:
Text included between two occurrences of the "++" string in the same paragraph is rendered as underlined in the HTML representation of a Markdown README.md file.

This is unfortunate when you have to write things like "C++" all over the place.

I believe the "++" modifier is not part of the Markdown syntax.

Note that I had to break up this message into four paragraphs to get the "++" string to display properly.
fields.summary: "++" string interpreted as underline in Markdown README.md, breaks C++ code (BB-9634)

fields.description:
I found a bug of REST API.

I tried this way:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/repository+Resource

bq. bq. "name"\\
"The name for the repository. When omitted, this assumes that value of the repo_slug part of the URL (optional)."



But I haven't specified "name", it was managed as "" (zero bytes string as repository name).\\
and some dashboard's history was broken.\\
many 500 errors were happen.
fields.summary: creating new repository with REST API makes empty name (BB-9633)

fields.description:
Since Yesterday I've had problems with pulling and pushing changes

git pull\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://ddereszewski@bitbucket.org/ddereszewski/magicbubble.git/': The requested URL returned error: 500

git push\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://ddereszewski@bitbucket.org/ddereszewski/magicbubble.git/': The requested URL returned error: 503

I just created a new repositiory (c3ebc6497dd94da88ca21203c53aaaac) but I can't access it as I instead get an error 500.

Could you please delete it as I managed to create another working repository for this project and I don't like to have non-working repository in my list.

Thanks.
fields.summary: error 500 with new repository
Error when create a repo
can't create bucket

fields.description:
When browsing the source directories, using the "branch" dropdown:\\
!http://i.imgur.com/NUH5nVx.png!

...doesn't affect any changes to the source view.  Tested with Firefox 25.0.1 on Win XP.

When switching branches while a source file is open in the browser, if it doesn't exist in the other branch, a 404 page is returned - so I presume the refresh only fails in the directory view.
fields.summary: Switching branches by dropdown in source browser fails to refresh file list (BB-9632)

fields.description:
This is happening on all my projects, since monday when I used a collegues bitbucket account to push some code.

git clone https://user@bitbucket.org/xxxxxxx/humanresource.git\\
Cloning into 'humanresource'...\\
error: The requested URL returned error: 403 while accessing https://user@bitbucket.org/xxxxxxx/humanresource.git/info/refs\\
fatal: HTTP request failed
fields.summary: The requested URL returned error: 403 while accessing https

fields.description: I have two branches in my repository, yesterday I reset the two branches to a previous commit and push --force. The push succeeded and two branches were backed to the specific commit. However, when I Click tab 'Branches', I just can't see the two branches. When I tried to create a new branch, I can see them in the 'Branch from' choice list.
fields.summary: Branches not seen after I reset branches and force push

fields.description:
Hi,\\
It would be nice if Bitbucket supported one of Stash's features, which also GitHub has it, build status api for commits as described here: https://developer.atlassian.com/stash/docs/latest/how-tos/updating-build-status-for-commits.html

With this API, we could better integrate BitBucket with our current CI server.
fields.summary: Better CI integration: Add a build status API for commits (BB-9631)

fields.description: test
fields.summary: test

https://api.bitbucket.org/firestormmedia/beryl/pull-request/2\\
rather than\\
https://www.bitbucket.org/firestormmedia/beryl/pull-request/2
fields.summary: Pull Request POST Hook pullrequest_created links['html'] is incorrect (BB-9630)

fields.description:
I have one repo in which there are (at least) 2 branches\\
One contains lot of files in one folder structure\\
The other contains the same files in another folder structure\\
When i switch from one branch to another, bitbucket doens't reflect the correct structure of folders. It remains on the current one and if i click one one not-existing folder, i get the so-called "Oops, you've found a dead link"\\
The workaround i found is to go to "Overview" , then go back to "Source" and then select my branch

Tks a lot for your resolution :-)
fields.summary: Bitbucket - Error in sourcebrowser when switching from one branch to another

fields.description:
Good morning,\\
after logging in using my google account, when the website askme to choose the username. Then I click "link an existing BitBucket account".\\
After filling my existing username and password, I get a 500 error with code 1bb478c372b646568fe772b226e9d6cf

Hope that this help.

Andrea
fields.summary: 500 error after Google Login & link existing account (BB-9629)
